you can squash Restart hive-server2 for Azure tests commit

nodes.bodyText:
Why? Is your intention to run this for  config-cdh5? (upcoming; already mentioned in this file)
Add a comment. Maybe
# config-empty's Hive 1.2 does not support Azure storage
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,6 +51,17 @@ jobs:
           if [ "${AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID}" != "" ]; then
             ./mvnw test -B -Dair.check.skip-all -pl presto-hive -P test-hive-glue
           fi
+      - name: Run Hive Azure ABFS Tests
+        if: matrix.config != 'config-empty'

nodes.bodyText:
for s3 tests we leverage auto-delete functionality to provide test isolation
https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/cbf0d04b766d7a90c69e8dd7bc18a48779441749/presto-hive-hadoop2/bin/run_hive_s3_tests.sh#L10
Azure has an equivalent: https://stackoverflow.com/a/56906611/65458
@electrum @anusudarsan can we have this enabled?
otherwise I would want this folder to be called ..._2, to ensure no conflicts in installations running previous versions of these tests, that used different set of test files (one vs four)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -18,6 +18,34 @@ exec_in_hadoop_master_container sed -i \
     -e "s|%ABFS_ACCOUNT%|${ABFS_ACCOUNT}|g" \
     /etc/hadoop/conf/core-site.xml
 
+# restart hive-server2 to apply S3 changes in core-site.xml
+docker exec "$(hadoop_master_container)" supervisorctl restart hive-server2
+retry check_hadoop
+
+# create test table
+table_path="abfs://${ABFS_CONTAINER}@${ABFS_ACCOUNT}.dfs.core.windows.net/presto_test_external_fs/"

nodes.bodyText: same comment as for abfs; & applies to wasb too
This test was never being run.

Why hash and cut the UUID? Using the full UUID doesn't make it any easier or harder to read, and it's not so many characters that it should cause problems.
I'd suggest a slightly more verbose name, in case someone needs to find a particular test at any point, something like "test-$(date +%Y-%m-%dT%H.%M.%S)-id-$(uuidgen)".
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,11 @@ test -v ABFS_CONTAINER
 test -v ABFS_ACCOUNT
 test -v ABFS_ACCESS_KEY
 
-start_docker_containers
+cleanup_hadoop_docker_containers
+start_hadoop_docker_containers
+
+test_directory="$(date '+%Y%m%d-%H%M%S')-$(uuidgen | sha1sum | cut -b 1-6)"

nodes.bodyText: This came from @findepi in e364b6b for S3. I'm inclined to agree, except for adding dots in the name.

nodes.bodyText: The sha1sum part might be an attempt to normalize the output case as uuidgen on macOS is uppercase but Linux is lowercase.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,11 @@ test -v ABFS_CONTAINER
 test -v ABFS_ACCOUNT
 test -v ABFS_ACCESS_KEY
 
-start_docker_containers
+cleanup_hadoop_docker_containers
+start_hadoop_docker_containers
+
+test_directory="$(date '+%Y%m%d-%H%M%S')-$(uuidgen | sha1sum | cut -b 1-6)"

nodes.bodyText:
The case shouldn't matter, because it's still only generated once (in any case, that's what tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' is for).
I wasn't sure about the dots, either; dashes work just as well.

+

nodes.bodyText:
This came from @findepi in e364b6b for S3

sha1sum is necessary if we want to cut (uuid's prefix is not random).
cut can be used because this is only for collision ties (we have date/time as well), so full uuid is enterpreisely redundant
nodes.diffHunk:

 test -v ABFS_ACCOUNT
 test -v ABFS_ACCESS_KEY
 
-start_docker_containers

+start_hadoop_docker_containers
+
+test_directory="$(date '+%Y%m%d-%H%M%S')-$(uuidgen | sha1sum | cut -b 1-6)"
